body: Designed with @ellisonbg
Looks nice.Please test with Vi, emacs or other full-screen editor that have a background different that black when screenshot, having the lineheight/font-size correct is tricky.

![capture d ecran 2014-12-16 a 09 56 08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/5450716/cea5acf6-8509-11e4-9dd2-6c063ba33230.png)

See you got the line height wrong.
(technically you should need the lineheight of exactly 1em)

In principle looks nice but a few issues on practicality.
Page should not scroll, font size and line height should not be base only on visual appearance, but exactly match font-height.

> See you got the line height wrong.

@ellisonbg it looks like we can't use the same line height as CodeMirror.  Like @Carreau says, we'll have to stick with 1em.
Review comments address, not to start unifying things...

Comments addressed, more improvements.

![screen shot 2014-12-16 at 2 32 09 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3292874/5463327/90e0bce0-8530-11e4-9799-f771c2a922ff.png)

---

![screen shot 2014-12-16 at 2 32 28 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3292874/5463328/94e9fb4e-8530-11e4-9545-91b29d512354.png)

---

![screen shot 2014-12-16 at 2 32 57 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3292874/5463329/977e1836-8530-11e4-88f2-57ad1882f962.png)

---

![screen shot 2014-12-16 at 2 33 25 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3292874/5463334/9a870eca-8530-11e4-8f22-357ad8c57630.png)
@takluyver shadow above page like you suggested
Where is the light coming from for the shadows in the terminal? IMO, lighting should come from the top and therefore the terminal should not have a shadow on the top.

> Where is the light coming from for the shadows in the terminal? IMO, lighting should come from the top and therefore the terminal should not have a shadow on the top.

The PR experiments with the light emanating from the user (a vector normal to the surface of the screen).
..  uniformly, everywhere.  All shadows have a 0,0 offset.
...this is intended to make the user feel more God-like.
:sun_with_face:
Ok, now this touches all the sub-apps.  I've just finished working on the text editor.  Ping @ellisonbg who requested this be done in this PR too.

Edit app: 

![screen shot 2014-12-17 at 3 34 45 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3292874/5481158/51fdc6ee-8602-11e4-9ace-cf68da5bfde5.png)
@fperez is observing that space bar in the terminal scrolls the entire page. As usual Linux/Chrome/username=fperez.

Also, problem with number of columns confusing tools like `mc`, see:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/57394/5481899/ecc918ae-860c-11e4-874d-b1e495688981.png)

> ...this is intended to make the user feel more God-like.

At least you made me laugh.
I require a plugin that show a different shadow depending on the eye for oculus rift.

> Also, problem with number of columns confusing tools like mc, see:

No, it's just because you believed that monospace font have always the same width ! Which is not true !
The subtlety is thta "all characters have the same width", but not all the time. Bold font are wider hehehe

See:

![capture d ecran 2014-12-18 a 18 02 30](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/5492256/30492032-86e0-11e4-86f8-7ff316b26a99.png)

![capture d ecran 2014-12-18 a 18 03 08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/5492257/304ac1b2-86e0-11e4-8f82-cdaf974dd154.png)

> Bold font are wider hehehe

AH!  Thanks for pointing this out @Carreau .  I was just thinking to myself " @fperez 's font must not actually be monospace ".  Hmm.  I think I have an idea of how this can be fixed.
Header height differs between editor and notebook

:(

Sent from my iPhone

> On Dec 18, 2014, at 9:04 AM, Matthias Bussonnier notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> Also, problem with number of columns confusing tools like mc, see:
> 
> No, it's just because you believed that monospace font have always the same width ! Which is not true !
> The subtlety is thta "all characters have the same width", but not all the time. Bold font are wider hehehe
> 
> See:
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
Terminal, use gray background also.
Notebook: View> hide toolbar. Should look the same than editor.
Editor: What the date ? Last modofied ? (can be separate PR, but taking note.)
I _think_  I would add a menu bar in terminal to get at least file new notebook and alike a get a "same header height" visual feeling.

> Terminal, use gray background also.

I'm -1 for doing this, because the terminal isn't a "page" like the notebook and text editor.  @ellisonbg what's your opinion?
